It is characterized by its long, slender fronds that can grow up to several meters in length, giving it a distinctive and elegant appearance. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its reproductive structures are small and clustered, often requiring specific pollinators for successful reproduction. Due to its limited habitat and susceptibility to environmental changes, Elongatia driessenii is considered a vulnerable species.
